files.README.md:
# Claude Code Marketplace

A curated collection of Claude Code plugins including agents, commands, and integrations for enhanced development workflows.

## About

This repository serves as a **Claude Code plugin marketplace**, hosting production-ready plugins that extend Claude Code's capabilities. Each plugin follows the official Claude Code plugin specification and can be installed with a single command.

## Installation

### Add This Marketplace

```bash
/plugin marketplace add andrew-nazymko/claude-code-marketplace
```

### Browse Available Plugins

```bash
/plugin
```

### Install a Plugin

```bash
/plugin install cv-generator
```

## Available Plugins

### ðŸ“„ CV Generator

**Category**: Career Tools
**Version**: 1.0.0

Generates ATS-optimized, tailored CVs by analyzing job vacancies against Andrew Nazymko's 15+ year career profile.

**Features:**
- Deep job vacancy analysis
- Intelligent experience matching
- ATS-optimized formatting
- Gap analysis with mitigation strategies
- Professional writing standards

**Usage:**
```bash
/plugin install cv-generator
/generate-cv
```

[Plugin Documentation](./plugins/cv-generator/README.md)

---

## Plugin Structure

Each plugin in this marketplace follows the official Claude Code plugin format:

```
plugins/
â””â”€â”€ plugin-name/
    â”œâ”€â”€ .claude-plugin/
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ plugin.json          # Plugin manifest
    â”œâ”€â”€ agents/                  # Specialized subagents
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ agent-name.md
    â”œâ”€â”€ commands/                # Slash commands
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ command-name.md
    â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/                   # Event handlers (optional)
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ hooks.json
    â””â”€â”€ README.md                # Plugin documentation
```

## Creating Your Own Plugin

1. Fork this repository
2. Create a new directory under `plugins/`
3. Follow the [Claude Code Plugin Reference](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/plugins-reference)
4. Test your plugin locally
5. Submit a pull request

### Plugin Manifest Template

```json
{
  "name": "your-plugin-name",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Your plugin description",
  "author": {
    "name": "Your Name",
    "email": "your.email@example.com"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/your-repo",
  "license": "MIT",
  "keywords": ["tag1", "tag2"],
  "agents": "agents/",
  "commands": "commands/"
}
```

## Plugin Categories

- **Career Tools** - CV generation, job search, interview prep
- **Development Tools** - Code generators, analyzers, refactoring tools
- **Productivity** - Workflow automation, templates, shortcuts
- **Documentation** - Documentation generators, formatters
- **Testing** - Test generators, coverage analyzers

## Requirements

- Claude Code (Terminal or VS Code)
- Plugins may specify required models (sonnet, opus, haiku)
- Some plugins may require specific tools (artifacts, web search, etc.)

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! To add a new plugin:

1. Ensure your plugin follows the official Claude Code plugin specification
2. Include comprehensive documentation
3. Test thoroughly before submitting
4. Update `.claude-plugin/marketplace.json` with your plugin details
5. Submit a pull request

### Quality Standards

All plugins should:
- Follow the official plugin structure
- Include clear documentation
- Provide usage examples
- Specify dependencies and requirements
- Use semantic versioning

## Documentation

- [Claude Code Plugins Announcement](https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-code-plugins)
- [Claude Code Plugin Reference](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/plugins-reference)
- [Claude Code Documentation](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code)

## Support

For issues or questions:
- Open an issue in this repository
- Check the [Claude Code documentation](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code)
- Join the Claude Code community discussions

## License

MIT License - See individual plugin directories for specific licenses.

## Author

**Andrew Nazymko**
- LinkedIn: [linkedin.com/in/andrewnazymko](https://linkedin.com/in/andrewnazymko)
- Email: andrew.nazymko@gmail.com
- Telegram: [@andrew_nazymko](https://t.me/andrew_nazymko)

## Version

1.0.0

---

**Note**: This is a community-maintained marketplace. Plugins are provided as-is. Please review each plugin's documentation and code before installation.
files.plugins/cv-generator/README.md:
# CV Generator Plugin

A Claude Code plugin that provides an intelligent CV/resume generator agent for Andrew Nazymko, creating tailored, ATS-optimized CVs based on job vacancy analysis.

## Installation

Add this marketplace to Claude Code:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add andrew-nazymko/claude-code-marketplace
```

Then install the plugin:

```bash
/plugin install cv-generator
```

## Features

### CV Generator Agent

A specialized agent that:

- **Analyzes Job Vacancies**: Deep analysis of technical requirements, experience levels, and domain expertise
- **Matches Experience**: Categorizes alignment as Strong Matches, Transferable Skills, or Gaps
- **Strategic Approach**: Adapts CV strategy based on match percentage (90%+, 70-90%, 50-70%)
- **ATS Optimization**: Keyword-optimized formatting for applicant tracking systems
- **Honest Gap Handling**: Transparent about missing skills with mitigation strategies
- **Professional Writing**: Clear, simple language without buzzwords

### Slash Command

- `/generate-cv` - Quick launch of the CV generator agent

## Usage

### Using the Agent

1. Launch the agent:
   ```
   /agents
   ```
   Select "cv-generator" from the list

2. Paste the complete job vacancy description

3. The agent will provide:
   - Match analysis report
   - Tailored CV (via artifacts)
   - Application guidance (if gaps exist)

### Using the Slash Command

```
/generate-cv
```

Then paste your job vacancy description.

## What the Agent Provides

### 1. Match Analysis Report
- Strong Matches with evidence
- Transferable Skills explanation
- Identified Gaps with severity ratings
- Recommended application strategy
- Key selling points

### 2. Generated CV
- Professional Summary tailored to the role
- Technical Skills organized by relevance
- Work Experience highlighting relevant projects
- ATS-optimized formatting
- 2-3 pages in length

### 3. Application Guidance
- Cover letter talking points
- Interview preparation suggestions
- Success probability assessment

## Profile Coverage

The agent has comprehensive data about Andrew Nazymko:

- **Experience**: 15+ years (2009-present)
- **Core Skills**: Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, PostgreSQL, Microservices
- **Domains**: Banking, E-commerce, Payment Systems, Enterprise Systems
- **Current Stack**: Java 17, Spring Boot, Angular, Kafka, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Kubernetes
- **Location**: Ukraine (Remote/Hybrid)
- **Languages**: English (Professional), Ukrainian (Native)

## Configuration

The plugin includes:

- **Agent**: `agents/cv-generator.md` - Main CV generation agent
- **Command**: `commands/generate-cv.md` - Quick launch slash command
- **Profile Data**: `agents/profile-data.json` - Comprehensive career profile

## Requirements

- Claude Code (Terminal or VS Code)
- Model: Sonnet (recommended)
- Tools: Artifacts (for CV output)

## Quality Standards

The agent ensures:
- All vacancy keywords naturally integrated
- Simple, professional language (no buzzwords)
- Active voice throughout
- Metrics and quantified achievements
- ATS-friendly formatting
- Honest about gaps and limitations

## License

MIT

## Author

Andrew Nazymko
- LinkedIn: [linkedin.com/in/andrewnazymko](https://linkedin.com/in/andrewnazymko)
- Email: andrew.nazymko@gmail.com
- Telegram: [@andrew_nazymko](https://t.me/andrew_nazymko)

## Version

1.0.0
